1.text: Choose a thick cut of meat.

2.text: Resist the temptation to outfit your filet with additional rubs or smother it in marinades.

3.text: Decide whether to salt the filet before or after grilling.

4.text: Wait for the filet to come to room temperature.

5.text: If possible, use lump charcoal over briquettes and try to stay away from gas grills.

6.text: Position your coals to form a hot side and a cool side in your grill.

7.text: Brush your filet with a little bit of oil.

8.text: Decide whether to cook your filet primarily over high heat or low heat.

9.text: Cook your filet over indirect, "cool" heat until the filet is about 15° - 20° F from your ideal temperature.

10.text: For a medium-rare filet, transfer it over to the direct, "hot" side of the grill when its temperature reaches 110° to 115° F.

11.text: Remove the filet when its internal temperature is 5° F away from its ideal temperature.

12.text: Make sure to let the steak rest for 5 to 10 minutes before cutting into it.

14.text: Serve and enjoy your perfectly cooked king of steaks.
